title: Greek-English (1920) Harmony of the Gospels Study
description:
The 1920 publication "A Harmony of The Gospels For Students Of The Life Of Christ" by A. T. Robertson is a significant work for biblical studies, particularly for those interested in the life and teachings of Jesus Christ. This book is based on the Broadus Harmony in the Revised Version and represents a comprehensive effort to synchronize the narratives of the four Gospels – Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.

A. T. Robertson, a distinguished scholar and the Chair of New Testament Interpretation at the Southern Baptist Theological Seminary in Louisville, Kentucky, compiled this harmony to facilitate a cohesive and chronological understanding of the Gospels. His work allows students and scholars to study the events of Christ's life in a streamlined and integrated manner, offering insights into how the different Gospel accounts complement and illuminate each other.

Robertson's harmony is particularly valuable for those studying the New Testament, the life of Jesus, and the harmonization of the Gospel narratives. His scholarly approach and expertise in New Testament interpretation make this work a useful resource for theological education and for anyone seeking a deeper understanding of the Gospels' portrayal of Christ's life.
